original: 3.     Licenses  AND  OWNERSHIP.
modified:
3. Permissions Granted and Title to Assets:

The Client hereby grants permission for the Service Provider to use, reproduce, distribute, and display any materials, including but not limited to content, trademarks, or logos provided by the Client, solely for the purpose of performing the Services described in this Agreement. The Client retains ownership of all such materials, and it is understood that the Service Provider does not acquire any rights to these materials beyond those expressly granted under this Agreement.

In case the Service Provider creates any original work or improvement during the performance of this Agreement, the Service Provider hereby assigns all right, title, and interest in such works to the Client, provided that the Client reimburses the Service Provider for any costs reasonably incurred by the Service Provider in creating such works. In the event that no such reimbursement is made within thirty (30) days of a written request by the Service Provider, the Client's rights to the original work or improvement shall terminate and revert back to the Service Provider. The Service Provider shall have a non-exclusive, royalty-free, worldwide license to use and display such works for any purpose, including promotional purposes, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Parties.

SpinRecords.com is hereby granted by NETTAXI a non-exclusive, worldwide, nontransferable, and revocable (at NETTAXI's sole discretion) license, royalty-free, to utilize the NETTAXI Brand Features, as they may be modified from time to time, for the purposes of this Agreement.

original: 7.     INDEMNITY  AND  LIMITATION  OF  LIABILITY.
ollama_generated:
7. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND INDEMNIFICATION PROVISIONS.

In the event that either Party is held liable to a third party for any reason arising from this Agreement or the performance thereof, the indemnifying Party shall only be responsible for direct damages, and the extent of such liability shall be limited to the amount paid by the indemnified Party's insurance carrier in respect of such claim. The indemnifying Party shall not have any obligation to indemnify or hold harmless the other Party for indirect, special, incidental, consequential, exemplary, or punitive damages arising out of or related to this Agreement or its performance. The indemnified Party shall provide prompt notice to the indemnifying Party in the event that a claim is made or threatened against it, and shall cooperate with the indemnifying Party in its defense at its own cost.

original: 7.1     Indemnification  by  Spinrecords.com. SpinRecords.com shall defend, ------------------------------------ indemnify and hold NETTAXI harmless from any and all damages, liabilities, costs and expenses (including, but not limited to reasonable attorneys' fees) incurred by NETTAXI  as a result of (i) any breach of this Agreement; (ii) any claim that the  SpinRecords.com  Brand  Features   or  any  part  thereof,  infringes  or misappropriates  any  Intellectual  Property  Right  of a third party; (iii) any claim arising out of NETTAXI's display of the SpinRecords.com Brand Features ; or (iv)  the  operation  of  the  SpinRecords.com  Pages .  NETTAXI  shall  provide SpinRecords.com  with  written notice of the claim and permit SpinRecords.com to control  the  defense,  settlement,  adjustment or compromise of any such claim.
modified:
7.1 Indemnification by NETTAXI. NETTAXI shall indemnify, defend, and hold SpinRecords.com harmless from any and all damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) incurred by SpinRecords.com as a result of: (i) any breach of this Agreement; (ii) any claim that NETTAXI's use or display of the SpinRecords.com Brand Features infringes upon or misappropriates any Intellectual Property Right of a third party; (iii) any claim arising out of the operation of the SpinRecords.com Pages; or (iv) any claim resulting from SpinRecords.com's use of NETTAXI's intellectual property. Upon receiving written notice of such a claim, SpinRecords.com shall have the right to control the defense, settlement, adjustment, or compromise of the claim.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for indemnification and control over legal proceedings has shifted from SpinRecords.com to NETTAXI. This means that if there is a claim related to the use or display of the SpinRecords.com Brand Features, or any issue arising from the operation of the SpinRecords.com Pages, NETTAXI will now be responsible for defending and indemnifying SpinRecords.com against any resulting damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses. Additionally, SpinRecords.com will have control over the defense, settlement, adjustment, or compromise of such claims.

This limitation of liability applies regardless of whether such damages were reasonably foreseeable or avoidable, and irrespective of the theory of recovery (whether contractual, tortious, statutory, or otherwise).

original: (a)     Insolvency  Event.  Either  may  terminate  this  Agreement by delivering  written  notice to the other party upon the occurrence of any of the following  events: (i) a receiver is appointed for either party or its property; (ii)  either  makes a general assignment for the benefit of its creditors; (iii) either  party  commences,  or  has  commenced  against it, proceedings under any bankruptcy,  insolvency  or  debtor's  relief  law,  which  proceedings  are not dismissed  within  sixty  (60)  days;  or  (iv)  either  party  is liquidated or Source: RAE SYSTEMS INC, 10-Q, 11/14/2000 dissolved.
modified: (a) Voluntary Termination Event: Either party may elect to terminate this Agreement at their discretion upon the occurrence of any one or more of the following events: (i) either party voluntarily enters into a restructuring agreement with its creditors; (ii) there is a proposal by either party for a composition, arrangement, or compromise with its creditors; (iii) either party takes, or has taken, any steps to seek protection under any insolvency, reorganization, or financial relief provision, which steps have not been withdrawn within sixty (60) days; or (iv) either party undergoes a rehabilitation, reorganization, or similar process that results in a change of its legal identity.

original: (c)     Default.  Either  party may terminate this Agreement effective upon  written  notice  to  the  other  if the other party violates any covenant, agreement,  representation  or warranty contained herein in any material respect or  defaults  or fails to perform any of its obligations or agreements hereunder in any material respect, which violation, default or failure is not cured within thirty  (30) days after notice thereof from the non-defaulting party stating its intention  to  terminate  this  Agreement  by  reason  thereof.
ollama_generated: (c) Default and Consequences: Either party retains the discretion to electively terminate this Agreement, upon providing written communication to the other, if it ascertains that the other party substantially breaches any provision, promise, assurance, or guarantee within this agreement, or persistently fails to meet its stipulated responsibilities or commitments in a significant manner. The non-breaching party shall extend a remediation period of thirty (30) days following delivery of written notice detailing the breach and intent to terminate this Agreement due to it. If the offending party rectifies the issue within this timeframe, the termination will not transpire.
